model

Class Computer

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.Player
        • model.Computer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Computer
extends Player
implements java.io.Serializable
    Class that represents the A.I. of a Battleship opponent. According to its ComputerType, its hit choices can be made pseudo-wisely or pseudo-randomly.
    Author:
    20027017 & 20031485
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      void crossCheck(int row, int col)
      Given a cell's coordinates, the Computer aims to the (at most) four cells vertically and horizontally surrounding the chosen cell.

      Utility method that prints the coordinates Computer still has to hit in its next turns.

        public Computer(int gameSize,
                ComputerType difficulty)
        Constructor for the class Computer.
        Parameters:
        gameSize - The size of the Battleship game grid.
        difficulty - The "intelligence" of the Computer.

        public void printNextHits()

      • printCoordinatesList

        public void printCoordinatesList()
        Utility method that prints the coordinates Computer still has to hit in its next turns.

      • computerHits

        public int[] computerHits(PlayerState state)
        According to the Player's state, the Computer decides where to aim for its next hit. If the Computer is "stupid", it will aim randomly.
        Parameters:
        state - The current Player's state.
        Returns:
        A bidimensional integer array containing the two coordinates the Computer has chosen to hit

      • randomHit

        public int[] randomHit()
        Randomly extract a couple of Coordinates from the list of coordinates Computer still has not hit.
        Returns:
        A bidimensional integer array containing the two coordinates.

      • smartHit

        public int[] smartHit(PlayerState state)
        Only if the Computer is set as "smart", it chooses a couple of coordinates more wisely.
        Parameters:
        state - The current Player's state.
        Returns:
        A bidimensional integer array containing the coordinates chosen.

      • crossCheck

        public void crossCheck(int row,
                       int col)
        Given a cell's coordinates, the Computer aims to the (at most) four cells vertically and horizontally surrounding the chosen cell.
        Parameters:
        row - The row coordinate of the chosen cell.
        col - The col coordinate of the chosen cell.

      • lineCheck

        public void lineCheck(Coordinates lastHit,
                      Coordinates lastSuccessfulHit,
                      ShipDirection direction)
        Given two couples of aligned Coordinates, the Computer chooses at most two other cells, aligned to the parameters, to be aimed to in its next hits.
        Parameters:
        lastHit - A Coordinates object containing the coordinates of the first cell.
        lastSuccessfulHit - A Coordinates object containing the coordinates of the second cell.
        direction - The alignment of the two cells.

      • clearNextHits

        public void clearNextHits()
        Empties the list of the next Coordinates the Computer wants to hit.

      • didComputerHit

        public void didComputerHit(PlayerState state)
        The Computer checks if its last hit was successful or not. according to the state the Player is in.
        Parameters:
        state - The current state of the Player.
